sentences.en: ...poor radio reception.
sentences.cn: …糟糕的广播接收效果。

sentences.en: Adjust the aerial's position and direction for the best reception.
sentences.cn: 调整天线的位置和方向以达到最佳接收效果。

sentences.en: All visitors must report to reception.
sentences.cn: 所有来宾必须到接待处报到。

sentences.en: At the reception they served smoked salmon.
sentences.cn: 在招待会上，他们端上了熏三文鱼。

sentences.en: Have him bring a car round to the reception.
sentences.cn: 让他把车开到前台来。

sentences.en: He had gone to the reception desk, presumably to check out.
sentences.cn: 他已经去前台了，可能是要办理退房手续。

sentences.en: He recently did the catering for a presidential reception.
sentences.cn: 他最近承办了一次总统招待会的宴席。

sentences.en: He was given a cool reception.
sentences.cn: 他受到了慢待。

sentences.en: He was last seen striding maniacally to the hotel reception.
sentences.cn: 最后一次看见他的时候，他正发疯般地大跨步走向饭店的前台。

sentences.en: I spoke to the girl on the reception desk.
sentences.cn: 我跟服务台的女孩说了一下。

sentences.en: It was a lavish reception as befitted a visitor of her status.
sentences.cn: 这场铺张的招待可算得正适合她这种身份的来访者。

sentences.en: It’s an ideal location for a wedding reception .
sentences.cn: 这里是举办喜宴的理想地点。

sentences.en: listeners complaining about poor reception
sentences.cn: 抱怨接收效果不好的听众

sentences.en: Mr Mandela was given a tumultuous reception in Washington.
sentences.cn: 曼德拉先生在华盛顿受到热情的款待。

sentences.en: Pope John Paul received a rapturous reception when he visited East Timor.
sentences.cn: 在访问东帝汶期间，教皇约翰·保罗受到了热烈的欢迎。

sentences.en: She was unsure of her reception after everything that had happened.
sentences.cn: 发生了这些事后，她对自己是否还受欢迎没把握。

sentences.en: The delegates gave him a warm reception.
sentences.cn: 代表团热烈欢迎他。

sentences.en: The museum is building a new reception centre for visitors.
sentences.cn: 博物馆正在修建新的来宾接待室。

sentences.en: The occasion was marked by a civic reception .
sentences.cn: 市里举行招待会庆祝这个特别的时刻。

sentences.en: The occasion was marked by a civic reception.
sentences.cn: 市里举行招待会庆祝这个特别的时刻。

sentences.en: The plans received a mixed reception from unions (= some people liked them, others did not ) .
sentences.cn: 各工会对这些计划反响不一。

sentences.en: The president may get a frosty reception in New Hampshire.
sentences.cn: 总统在新罕布什尔州可能会受到冷遇。

sentences.en: The team was given a rousing reception by the fans.
sentences.cn: 球队受到了球迷的热烈欢迎。

sentences.en: We arranged to meet in reception at 6.30.
sentences.cn: 我们约定6:30在接待处会面。

words.tran_cn: 被一般承认的；被认为标准的
接受能力；[生理] 感受性
收到；接受；迎接（receive的过去分词）

trans.tran_en: a particular type of welcome for someone

trans.tran_cn: 接待，欢迎，招待会，接待处
trans.tran_en: a particular type of welcome for someone, or a particular type of reaction to their ideas, work etc
